2023-07-01T15:28:59Z: After all that, the final word goes to Dilano van ’t Hoff, who sadly lost his life earlier today in a FRECA race at Spa. Autosport sends its thoughts and condolences to all of his family, friends and loved ones.
2023-07-01T15:22:58Z: So, even though it had little impact on the final result, are you Team Max or Team Checo for that first lap?
2023-07-01T15:19:06Z: Have you caught your breath after the F1 sprint race? Here's the race report: https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/f1-austrian-gp-verstappen-dominates-after-first-lap-tussle-with-perez/10490106/
2023-07-01T15:09:23Z: Verstappen and Perez discuss their close moments at the exit of Turn 1 and at Turn 3 on the opening lap. It looks like they don't see the incidents the same way, but all is fair in love and war between team-mates.
2023-07-01T15:07:57Z: That was one heck of a sprint race! Overtakes everywhere you looked, pitstop gambles paying off, but Verstappen still won by 21s.
2023-07-01T15:06:44Z: Apologises, it was Ocon vs Russell at the finish line, with Ocon just taking seventh place ahead of the Mercedes driver.
2023-07-01T15:05:52Z: Sainz takes third for Ferrari, as Stroll defends from Aston Martin team-mate Alonso to keep fourth place. Hulkenberg fends off Ocon to take sixth place at the finish line!
2023-07-01T15:04:23Z: Verstappen wins the Austrian GP by 21s from Perez!
2023-07-01T15:03:51Z: No! Russell takes eighth place! The pitstop gamble pays off.
2023-07-01T15:03:29Z: Hulkenberg gets by Norris and Ocon to grab sixth place - so can the McLaren keep clear of Russell to keep the final points place?
2023-07-01T15:02:42Z: Verstappen must be wondering what all the fuss is about, as he starts the final lap with a 20.2s lead.
2023-07-01T15:02:15Z: Piastri and Albon bang wheels as the McLaren driver nips by into 12th place on lap 23.
2023-07-01T15:01:06Z: Russell is now ahead of Gasly for ninth place and chasing after Hulkenberg for the final points place.
2023-07-01T15:00:14Z: Action everywhere you look - except for the leaders who are in a race of their own - as Hamilton, Albon and Bottas go three-wide into Turn 4 and somehow don't clattered into each other.
2023-07-01T14:59:25Z: Hulkenberg, the highest-placed pitter, gets back up to eighth passing Gasly. Now he has 12s to gain to catch Norris.
2023-07-01T14:58:09Z: Albon and Leclerc pit from the points places - but they are leapfrogged by Russell at pit exit - so the Merc gamble pays off!
2023-07-01T14:56:31Z: Hulkenberg, Hamilton, Magnussen, Sargeant, de Vries, and Zhou all pit for dry tyres! Just five laps to go so it was now or never.
2023-07-01T14:55:28Z: Piastri also pits for dry tyres, as all eyes turn to Russell's lap times for the soft tyre effect.
2023-07-01T14:54:59Z: Stroll, with DRS, darts by Hulkenberg on the run to Turn 3 to take fourth place.
2023-07-01T14:54:24Z: Verstappen has a comfortable 11.7s gap in the lead over Perez, so aside from any dramas, that battle looks done.
2023-07-01T14:53:39Z: Leclerc slips off the track at the final corner and that gifts Norris ninth place at the end of lap 15. Behind them Russell gambles with a pitstop for slick tyres - and DRS is enabled.
2023-07-01T14:52:52Z: The Ocon blockage has Leclerc, Norris, Russell and Hamilton in the train now.
2023-07-01T14:51:55Z: Ocon and Leclerc come inches away from a huge crash on the exit of Turn 4  but they somehow avoid tripping over each other. Ocon is doing everything he can to keep hold of the final points position.
2023-07-01T14:49:57Z: Hulkenberg's Haas doesn't have the traction of its rivals out of the slow corners, and Sainz blasts by to take third place from the German on lap 13.
2023-07-01T14:48:49Z: On lap 12, Hulkenberg's defence is breached as Perez nips by at Turn 5 to regain second place.
2023-07-01T14:47:14Z: Verstappen is now 8s clear of Hulkenberg, who is coming under attack from Perez.
2023-07-01T14:46:47Z: Hamilton and Magnussen go wheel-to-wheel through Turns 4 and 5, but the Dane has to yield to give the Mercedes 12th place.
2023-07-01T14:45:50Z: Alonso suspects the track will dry out before the end of the race. There's still 14 laps to go so this could get hairy.
2023-07-01T14:45:07Z: Russell gets his elbows out to take the inside line at Turn 3 on Magnussen and gets the move done for 11th place at Turn 4.
2023-07-01T14:42:48Z: Verstappen is clearing off at the front with a 4.5s lead over Hulkenberg, who in turn is edging clear of Perez with a 1.5s gap.
2023-07-01T14:41:33Z: A lap later Leclerc goes from attacker to defender, as Norris gives it a go around the outside of Turn 4 to get the inside into Turn 5, but the move doesn't stick.
2023-07-01T14:40:34Z: Leclerc puts his front wing ahead of Ocon, but can't make the move stick with less grip, to allow the French driver to keep hold of eighth out of Turn 6.
2023-07-01T14:39:12Z: Verstappen's lead is up to 2.4s over Hulkenberg who is defending second place well from Perez.
2023-07-01T14:36:33Z: After that nervy opening lap, Verstappen is pulling clear now with a 1.7s lead over Hulkenberg with Perez in third. Further back, Magnussen and Russell trade overtakes for 11th.
2023-07-01T14:35:26Z: Norris has had a nightmare start, dropping to 10th, while Hamilton is up to 13th.
2023-07-01T14:34:37Z: Here we go! Perez leads out of Turn 1 after a ginger start by Verstappen, but the Dutchman fights back at Turn 3 and regains the lead at Turn 4 - that pushes Perez behind Hulkenberg!
2023-07-01T14:32:51Z: Bottas backs out of his slick tyre gamble and pits at the end of the formation lap. Ah well.
2023-07-01T14:32:09Z: Perez locks up under braking at Turn 3 and takes to the run-off. He gets away with it, but that'll cause him a fright for the race start.
2023-07-01T14:31:11Z: The formation lap is under way and all the drivers have got away safely. Strap in, everyone.
2023-07-01T14:29:54Z: I, for one, wish Bottas well. It is a risk but it could be glorious.
2023-07-01T14:28:44Z: Bottas, starting 19th, has rolled the dice! He's the only dry to go for dry tyres, a set of mediums, and everyone else has played safe with intermediate tyres.
2023-07-01T14:27:30Z:
Spot the dry patch. That was left by the safety car... it'll dry up quick, but quick enough over 24 laps?
    
 
Photo by: Alex Kalinuackas
2023-07-01T14:23:28Z: All F1 teams will keep their starting tyre selection a secret until the grid gets cleared, so we've got a few minutes until we find out who sticks and who twists.
2023-07-01T14:20:57Z: Will any of the drivers be brave and gamble starting on dry tyres? It is wet but it isn't soaking and will dry as the F1 cars hoover the wet stuff off the track. If it dries up enough, it could mean no need to pit to slicks during the sprint.
2023-07-01T14:17:36Z: The official risk of rain is set at 30%, but anyone at the track would put that at 100%. This'll be the first wet sprint race, so that's something.
2023-07-01T14:16:01Z:
The latest from the grid is Mercedes was late putting its gazebo up for Russell's grid box, but all is well now.
    
 
Photo by: Alex Kalinauckas
2023-07-01T14:13:19Z: A couple news flashes to update you with before the sprint: Leclerc was given a five-place grid drop for impeding Piastri in this morning's quali, while Haas has been given a suspended €5000 fine for an unsafe release with Hulkenberg: https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/leclerc-gets-three-place-grid-drop-for-austria-f1-sprint-race/10490048/
2023-07-01T14:10:43Z: The wet stuff is coming down on the grid ahead of the Austrian GP sprint race, and the gazebos have gone up. Could this open up to be anyone's race, or will the Red Bull front row lockout pull clear?
2023-07-01T14:06:54Z: Hello one and all! Who fancies a sprint race in the wet? Well, you are in luck...
2023-07-01T11:00:01Z: And before I depart, here is the full report from an enthralling sprint qualifying session. The Sprint itself will get underway at 15:30 BST, and we'll be back in advance to bring you all of the build-up from the Red Bull Ring. https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/f1-austrian-gp-verstappen-beats-perez-to-sprint-shootout-pole/10489949/
2023-07-01T10:57:38Z: With rain still forecast for this afternoon's sprint, Norris will likely be eyeing the opportunity to top the F1 podium for the first time, even if he will publicly suggest a top three finishing position will be the goal.
2023-07-01T10:50:38Z: Haas is getting used to using its celebration graphics, with this performance coming quickly on the tail of Hulkenberg's stunning qualifying in Canada.
2023-07-01T10:46:37Z: Ferrari lockout the third row with Sainz ahead of Leclerc with Aston Martin also line astern on the fourth row - Alonso P7 and Stroll P8.
2023-07-01T10:45:31Z: Norris is third for McLaren but take a bow Hulkenberg and Haas - he will start on the second row in P4!
2023-07-01T10:45:03Z: Perez improves at the last to join him on the front row.
2023-07-01T10:44:44Z: The clock hits zero and Verstappen improves again! A 1m05.371 scores him pole for the sprint!
2023-07-01T10:42:20Z: He goes P5, one place behind team-mate Sainz and six-tenths off provisional pole man, Verstappen. Remember, Leclerc will start from the front row on Sunday.
2023-07-01T10:41:06Z: Leclerc is electing to run in the gap between the traditional two runs that the others are all completing.
2023-07-01T10:40:25Z: There appears to be little to separate the used softs and fresh medium compounds, with Sainz and Hulkenberg P4 and 5 on the harder rubber.
2023-07-01T10:39:11Z: That advantage immediately tells for Verstappen, who fires in a 1m04.613s! Norris is currently P2, four-tenths back.
2023-07-01T10:38:34Z: Hulkenberg and Sainz have fitted new soft tyres for the start of the session. Verstappen is on new softs, but the rest are on used softs.
2023-07-01T10:36:57Z: Here we go! SQ3 is go!
2023-07-01T10:36:35Z: But here comes the rain! A few spots at Turn 1 are being reported to the drivers.
2023-07-01T10:36:02Z: We have just one minute to go until the final part of sprint qualifying starts.
2023-07-01T10:35:15Z: Replays have shown Hulkenberg bouncing his Haas into the air after clipping a tyre that had just come off his car when leaving his pit box. Team principal Steiner has confirmed no one was injured in the incident.
2023-07-01T10:31:32Z: For Haas, it's double-delight as Magnussen (P6) and Hulkenberg (P10) both make it through!
2023-07-01T10:30:58Z: But none of the bottom five improve by enough, and Albon, Gasly, Tsunoda, De Vries and Russell are the drivers to fall out in SQ2.
2023-07-01T10:30:01Z: Verstappen returns to the top with a 1m05.371s.
2023-07-01T10:29:40Z: Leclerc takes the chequered flag and goes fourth.
2023-07-01T10:29:17Z: These are now likely to be the final efforts of the session.
2023-07-01T10:28:58Z: Sainz is flying and goes quickest with a 1m05.434s!
2023-07-01T10:28:27Z: De Vries improved to P11, but his time has since been deleted for a track limits violation, pushing him down to P14.
2023-07-01T10:27:59Z: Less than two minutes remain and a handful of drivers have stopped for fresh tyres. This could all change in the coming moments.
2023-07-01T10:27:26Z: And here's Ocon! The Monaco podium man goes to the top with a 1m05.604s! Magnussen is third with an impressive effort in the Haas.
2023-07-01T10:26:47Z: As the second round of laps are registered, Leclerc drops back to P12.
2023-07-01T10:24:11Z: Righting that slightly, Leclerc improves to P9. He is one-tenth clear of the drop mark.
2023-07-01T10:23:37Z: With his first effort, Leclerc is still struggling for pace and is P14 while his Ferrari team-mate, Sainz, has put his car into P2.
2023-07-01T10:22:59Z: But here come the Aston Martin duo, with Alonso second and Stroll going fourth. Russell is still stuck in the garage.
2023-07-01T10:22:20Z: Verstappen sets the first time of the session with a 1m05.624s effort. Norris is second - four-tenths back.
2023-07-01T10:21:10Z: 14 of the 15 drivers have now taken to the track on soft tyres but Russell remains in the garage following his reporting of a hydraulic issue.
2023-07-01T10:19:32Z: And we go again! SQ2 has a lot to live up to!
2023-07-01T10:19:09Z: For a brief moment - before the 10-minute SQ2 begins - a word for Haas. Hulkenberg was P3 in the opening session with Magnussen P6.
2023-07-01T10:16:13Z: Escaping notice was Perez. The Red Bull driver ended that session in P14, avoiding a humiliating exit by less that one-tenth!
2023-07-01T10:14:32Z: Zhou, Piastri, Hamilton, Bottas and Sargeant are the five that drop out in an absolutely frantic session!
2023-07-01T10:14:05Z: Leclerc survives in P15 by the skin of his teeth!
2023-07-01T10:13:51Z: Hamilton is out! He got stuck in traffic on his lap and returned to the pits. He will start from P18!
2023-07-01T10:13:27Z: Sainz puts in a heroic effort to go fastest of all with a 1m06.187s!
2023-07-01T10:12:56Z: Leclerc improves to eighth but he's dropping like a stone as others cross the line.
2023-07-01T10:12:07Z: A poor effort from Leclerc on medium tyres leaves him P16! One minute remains for him to save his session.
2023-07-01T10:11:39Z: Hamilton's session-topping time has been deleted!
2023-07-01T10:11:22Z: Sainz finally returns to the track with 90 seconds remaining. He's on an old set of soft tyres and is currently last.
2023-07-01T10:10:52Z: All change at the top, as Hamilton and Alonso find speed - Hamilton leads the way with a 1m06.624s!
2023-07-01T10:10:15Z: Hulkenberg goes to P2, falling one-tenth shy of Perez at the top, just as Piastri is blocked by Leclerc as the Ferrari driver attempted to return to the pits.
2023-07-01T10:08:46Z: Red Bull now take to the top with Perez leading the way from team-mate Verstappen. A 1m07.085s is the current benchmark, although Perez was on soft rubber, and Verstappen medium.
2023-07-01T10:07:53Z: Sainz remains in the garage as we tick into the final five minutes of the session.
2023-07-01T10:07:21Z: We're already halfway through SQ1 and rain is beginning to appear on the lens of the helicopter camera. For Gasly, Bottas, Zhou, Sargeant and Sainz, that is not good news at all!
2023-07-01T10:06:29Z: Verstappen returns to the top with his second effort but he is quickly pushed back with Norris not at the top and the Dutchman P7. Norris' time is a 1m07.755s.
2023-07-01T10:05:30Z: Verstappen's first time was deleted for - you guessed it - a track limits violation!
2023-07-01T10:05:04Z: The times begin to come in but, as we said, the times will drop and drop and drop. De Vries now tops the pile with a 1m08.898s.
2023-07-01T10:03:10Z: Where the track has been declared wet, drivers are able to use whichever compound they want, rather than being forced to run the medium compound in this segment. However, Magnussen and Verstappen have both elected to run the yellow-walled medium tyre regardless.
2023-07-01T10:01:53Z: No rain is forecast for the next 20 minutes, so the track should improve rapidly.
2023-07-01T10:00:54Z: SQ1 is go! The only cars on intermediate tyres are the two Williams. All other drivers are on soft slicks.
2023-07-01T09:59:34Z: One minute to go, then the lights will go green for SQ1. The traffic queue is forming at the end of the pitlane!
2023-07-01T09:56:14Z: At Aston Martin, Stroll out-qualified Alonso for only the second time this season on Friday. Alonso will be looking to 'right' this in the coming session.
2023-07-01T09:54:41Z: Returning to the on-track action, we are now just five minutes away from the sprint qualifying session, with Verstappen looking to continue his dominance of the 2023 season.
2023-07-01T09:53:01Z: But before we go any further, we must pay tribute to former Force India deputy team principal, Robert Fernley, who has died, at the age of 70. The thoughts of everyone at Autosport are with his family and friends.https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/former-force-india-f1-boss-fernley-dies-aged-70/10489741/
2023-07-01T09:49:09Z:
Picking up on a couple of threads from Friday, despite Sergio Perez's fourth Q3 miss in succession, Red Bull boss Christian Horner has dismissed speculation that the Mexican's seat is at risk. 
https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/red-bull-quashes-talk-that-perezs-f1-seat-at-risk/10489836/
2023-07-01T09:47:30Z: There was significant rain that fell on Friday night and throughout the morning, but this has now abated, with a dry line seeming to appear on the track. Even still, intermediate tyres appear to be the way to go for the start of SQ1.
2023-07-01T09:46:16Z: Good morning and welcome to the Red Bull Ring for sprint qualifying at the Austrian Grand Prix.
